triples.name: Functional programming
triples.relevance: The paper extends functional programming theory to include input/output capabilities while maintaining program verifiability.

triples.name: Input/output
triples.relevance: The paper develops new operational semantics and verification methods for functional I/O in lazy languages.

triples.name: Formal verification
triples.relevance: The paper develops formal verification methods for programs engaged in I/O, extending functional programming's verification capabilities.

triples.name: Operational semantics
triples.relevance: The paper obtains, for the first time, operational semantics for three widely implemented I/O mechanisms in lazy languages.

triples.name: Lazy evaluation
triples.relevance: The paper develops I/O semantics specifically for lazy languages, one of which is mentioned as a major implementation context.

triples.name: Monad (functional programming)
triples.relevance: The paper develops semantics for monadic I/O, a key pattern for handling side effects in functional programming.

triples.name: Bisimulation
triples.relevance: The paper uses applicative bisimulation (Abramsky's theory) as the theoretical foundation for its operational semantics.
